text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
IDMPPhPModel 0..*ElementIDMP Pharmaceutical Product logical model
identifier 0..*BackboneElementIdentifiers
l1_identifier 0..1IdentifierIDMP PhPID Level 1
l2_identifier 0..1IdentifierIDMP PhPID Level 2
l3_identifier 0..1IdentifierIDMP PhPID Level 3
l4_identifier 0..1IdentifierIDMP PhPID Level 4
Example (illustrative): 0x073AF2E5B92AE19E8B67635AFFB3D6CA
ingredient 1..*BackboneElementIngredient(s) that are part of the product, with therapeutical usage or not
substance 1..1CodeableConceptCodification of the substance
Example (illustrative): Amlodipine Besilate
strength 1..1BackboneElementAuthorized strength of the substance
strengthValue 1..1BackboneElementStrength of the substance in this product
numerator 1..1SimpleQuantityStrength numerator
Example (illustrative): 5 mg
denominator 1..1SimpleQuantityStrength denominator
boss 1..1codebase | base-modifier | ref-substance
Binding: BoSS - Basis of Substance Strength options (required)
pattern 1..1codeoral-solid | injectable
Binding: Presentation pattern Value Set (required)
concentration_presentation 1..1codeconcentration | presentation
Binding: Concentration or Presentation Value Set (required)
unit_of_presentation 0..1CodeableConceptunit of presentation if strength is by presentation
Example (edqm): 10210000 capsule, hard
doseForm 1..1CodeableConceptAuthorized Dose Form
Example (edqm): 10210000 capsule, hard

Documentation for this format

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Ingredient(s) that are part of the product, with therapeutical usage or not
element.definition: Ingredient(s) that are part of the product, with therapeutical usage or not

element.short: Strength of the substance in this product
element.definition: Strength of the substance in this product

element.comment: not needed from countries, will be looked up by substance
not needed from countries, will be looked up by dose form
not needed from countries, will be looked up by dose form

element.definition: unit of presentation is strength is by presentation
element.comment: not needed from countries, will be looked up by dose form
